answers.answer: I've done 4 completely naturally. I am in love with the shower during my labors. It feels so good. That and yoga balls. :)
How did you deal with the pain?... were you in the hospital and they gave you the freedom to do as you please? I've been told once you go in the have you just lay in a bed

It depends on the hospital and the dr. I've been in both situations. So I would ask your dr which policy they follow. As for pain management, it sounds nuts I know, but I did crosswords, Facebook, anything to distract. And m6 hubby would use a tennis ball to press against my back (I always have back labor).
That sounds like how ill be doing it to.. just going to have to distract myself.. thank you for your help! :)

No problem :) if you have anything else you want to ask or just want to talk about, you can totally message me :) I really don't mind sharing what has worked/ not worked for me. Good luck! And I would also suggest starting on a birth plan. It will make it much easier for everyone to be on the same page. ;)

Ladies I'm so excited to hear your post and comment. And I look forward to us all sharing together as I also want all natural. I have so many friends that have tried but end up getting the epidural. So it sounds like a lot is mind of matter then possibly? Getting yourself in the zone to just stay calm ?

It is a lot of determination to it. It isn't something for everyone and I get that. But if it is something you really want, you really have to kinda commit to it. :) You are also welcome to inbox me if you have any questions about it.  :)
This is my second. My first I went all natural what worked for me was the shower, the ball and lots walking. I had wonderful nurses that did everything withme. Don't worry u will do fine :-)
Isn't the ball the greatest thing ever? Are you going natural again?

With my first, I was induced and confined to bed the whole time (22 hours). I refused the epidural but did end up getting IV Stadol. This time I am fairly bound and determined to go pain-med free. I'm not going to feel right calling it a natural labor, the way it's going. I've already had three doses of prostaglandin gel to attempt to induce.But breathing exercises and acupressure helped me loads during my first labor. This time I want to use the labor ball, walking, and the tub as well. And distraction really is key, that's why breathing exercises work.My doctor this time around is awesome. She has been doing everything she can to help me with my "natural" labor, despite my bordering on preeclampsia. Finding the right doctor can make a huge difference.

This is great! I appreciate all your feed back will defiantly keep it in the front of my mind when finishing my birth plan... I really feel like I'm going to have put in 9 months of working hard to be healthy and make everything right for baby why mess it up at the end... I watched this really great documentary an I wish I could remember the name ill post it if I remember... but a quote I that really got me was that"society is making women feel that they can't birth children" with all the medications I just would rather be a tough cookie for this life event and this way I'm still doing the best or baby :)
That's it! ha I know its a little dated but man it was full of information!

I have 4 kiddos, 3 were natural births.  I will never have an epidural again!  Worst experience ever!  My first two were natural and I had no idea what I was doing.  With my forth pregnancy I said no epidural and started the hypno birthing book.  My husband was super supportive of it which helped.  My forth labor was so much nicer.  I had a birthing ball and walked around as much as I could and practiced my hypnobirthing techniques.

question: So I am 29 weeks pregnant and I'm doing my research on labor and delivery.. I made the mistake of watching a labor, never will I do that again!haha... but I have been looking into the meds and procedures and I am really thinking of doing this completely natural and trying to stay home as long as I can...I don't have a lot of help or input around here so I'm just looking for some advice or experiences.. thanks ladies
title: natural pregnancy
